info.game_comments:
2001 Teen Tournament semifinal game 1.
From the Pennsylvania Convention Center in Philadelphia.

(1, 1).clue: Disney sold everything from Cruella's ancestral painting to the dogs' pull-toy in this fur-ocious sequel

(3, 1).clue: Celebrated for his diary, Samuel Pepys was born on Feb. 23, 1633 in this world capital

(4, 1).clue: Japan's first modern university was the university of this city, established in 1877

(6, 1).clue: Aesop could tell you this insect was hopping & singing instead of "toiling & moiling" like those workaholic ants

(1, 2).clue: A hungry fan scarfed down Lucy Liu's "Fighting Muffins" from this film

(3, 2).clue: Appropriately, Pepys began his diary on this date in 1660

(4, 2).clue: This college, the oldest in the U.S., was founded in 1636 as Newtowne College

(6, 2).clue: Unlike frogs, these animals don't jump far, they make short hops & even walk

(1, 3).clue: This villain's chariot was sold for over $7,000 at the Auction Powers website

(3, 3).clue: Samuel Pepys attended Magdalene College at this university

(4, 3).clue: This Missouri city on the Mississippi has the oldest college west of the Mississippi

(6, 3).clue: The mudskipper, seen here, climbs trees & hops on land, but it's actually one of these

(1, 4).clue: Fox Auctions isn't saying if it's Patrick Stewart's or Ian McKellen's coffee cup from this film

(3, 4).clue: In 1667 Pepys wrote about the panic caused by the appearance of the Dutch fleet in the Medway & this river

(4, 4).clue: The oldest existing university is Karueein at Fez, founded in 859 A.D. in this north African country

(6, 4).clue: Unlike the kangaroo, this close relative can be brightly colored  & as small as a rabbit

(1, 5).clue: Beefy, a prop bulldog, includes its rubber spiked collar from this Adam Sandler film

(3, 5).clue: On June 15, 1665 Pepys noted that during the week 112 had died from this event, also called the Black Death

(4, 5).clue: Founded in 1411, Scotland's oldest university was named after this apostle, Scotland's patron saint

(5, 5).clue: A service line,an attack line,a net,a ball

(6, 5).clue: The gerboa & the kangaroo this, seen here, share identical traits, but have very different ancestors

(1, 1).clue: Joseph Lister used carbolic acid to do this to his surgical instruments, a medical first

(2, 1).clue: David Letterman was a real letterman, belonging to Sigma Chi, one of these organizations

(3, 1).clue: This branch of the military was put in charge of the Manhattan Project

(4, 1).clue: Established in 1885, Niagara Reservation at Prospect Point in this state is the USA's oldest state park

(5, 1).clue: In the 1600s Pedro Calderon's "Autos Sacramentales" dramatized the beliefs of this Christian church

(6, 1).clue: Woody, Bullseye & Jesse make it to Andy's room with Buzz' help

(1, 2).clue: This over 900-foot landmark was designed for the 1889 Exposition in Paris

(2, 2).clue: To pass off someone else's writing as your own

(3, 2).clue: Using Pu-239, an isotope of this element, the atomic bomb was tested at Alamogordo in the summer of 1945

(4, 2).clue: Wyoming's Grand Teton National Park is only 7 miles south of this other national park

(5, 2).clue: J.S. Bach's B Minor one of these religious compositions is "heavy", man

(6, 2).clue: Jennifer Lopez & Matthew McConaughey don't marry who they planned; they meet in the park & dance together

(1, 3).clue: In 1876 this woman was proclaimed empress of India

(2, 3).clue: This synonym for "basic" is used to describe a type of school

(3, 3).clue: The Enola Gay dropped the bomb on Hiroshima; Bockscar dropped the bomb on this city

(4, 3).clue: Some of America's finest glacial carvings can be found in Ohio's Kelley's Island State Park in this Great Lake

(5, 3).clue: In the Piero della Francesca work seen here, he's the saint pictured with Jesus

(6, 3).clue: Brendan Fraser's last wish is a good deed & it triggers an escape clause which saves his soul

(1, 4).clue: This Colorado peak finder was killed during the War of 1812 in what's now Toronto

(2, 4).clue: This 10-letter adjective means "winding" or "like a snake"

(3, 4).clue: The A-bomb test site was named this, after the John Donne poem "Batter My Heart, Three-Personed God"

(4, 4).clue: Sequoia National Park is home to the giant General Sherman tree & this tallest California mountain

(5, 4).clue: "Ayyam Min Havati", "Days from My Life", is a classic in this language by Muslim activist Zaynab Al-Ghazali

(6, 4).clue: Julia Stiles passes the Juilliard tryouts with her hip hop routine

(1, 5).clue: In the middle of the century David Livingstone crossed this desert in the southwest of Africa

(2, 5).clue: It's the oxygen-carrying pigment in red blood cells

(3, 5).clue: This Los Alamos director recalled the words "Now I am become death...destroyer of worlds" during the first test

(4, 5).clue: Huge stone statues are a feature of Chile's Rapa Nui National Park on this island

(5, 5).clue: This series of Christian thrillers that includes "The Indwelling" has sold over 15 million copies

(6, 5).clue: Sean Connery finishes his second novel & dies; he wants Robert Brown to write the foreword

(0, 0).clue: He's the last character to die in "Julius Caesar"
